  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Stringable

    public class NoSpeciation<G extends Genotype<?>>
extends Speciator<G,Species<G>>
    The default speciator simply assigns all individuals of the population to a single species.
    Author:
    O. J. Coleman

    • Method Detail

      • speciate

        public void speciate(Population<G,?> population,
            java.util.List<Species<G>> species)
        Description copied from class: Speciator
        Divide the given Population into species. Species may be added/removed to/from the given list of Species. Individuals in the Population should be added/removed to/from Species with the methods Species.addMember(Individual) and Species.removeMember(Individual).
        Specified by:
        speciate in class Speciator<G extends Genotype<?>,Species<G extends Genotype<?>>>
        Parameters:
        population - The population to speciate.
        species - The (current) Species.
